passages.text: India (Sajjid Z Chinoy)- 2Q GDP surges past expectations, printing at \(7.8\%\) - Service sector growth supported strength- Marking up FY26 GDP growth forecast to \(6.8\%\) - July IP surprised to the upside, printing \(3.5\%\) -

Today's 2Q GDP print exceeded our expectations coming in at \(7.8\%\) - oya (J.P. Morgan: \(6.9\%\) , Consensus: \(6.7\%\) ) accelerating from \(7.4\%\) - oya in 1Q25. While the level of growth was higher across the board, the qualitative dynamics we had anticipated played out (see GDP preview).

MSCI India (\$ index) fell for the second consecutive month, declining by \(2.4\%\) in August, driven by additional tariff implementation expected to hit growth, persistent FII selling, surge in fund raising and a weaker INR. Meanwhile, the downside was limited by a largely- inline Jun- 25 Q earnings season, announcements on GST reforms, and lower oil prices. MSCI India underperformed MSCI APxJ/EM indices by \(3.8\% /3.6\%\) respectively. Large caps fell by \(1.5\%\) , outperforming small/mid- caps, which fell by \(2.8\%\) each. Nifty 50 was down \(1.4\%\) , closing the month at 24,427. However, global equities posted a gain of \(2.4\%\) for the month. Among the major regions, MSCI Brazil/Japan were the best performers \((+9.2\% / + 6.9\%\) respectively), while India was the worst performer \((- 2.4\%)\) .

Reliance hosted their 48th AGM on \(29^{\text{th}}\) August. While management walked through key developments and plans for each of the company's businesses, the key announcement was the intention to list Reliance Jio (telecom) by June 2026. This may not be 'value unlocking' anymore as Street valuations for Jio in RIL's SoTP seem to have been marked to market to peer multiples already. Yet, the probability of higher tariffs into the IPO increases, which could be a catalyst for the RIL stock. There have been concerns of an eventual holding company discount crystallizing for RIL (post Jio listing), but a fair degree of the discount seems already built in. Reliance's relative valuations appear reasonable. Maintain O/W.
Reliance Industries Ltd (Sanjay Mookim) (RELIANCE IN, OW)
